column4: hi, i lost my mysql dbs, but i have the wamp directory, can i recover databases from there?
wamp? that is windows
you have the windows-files and want to put it on a lamp-installation?
no, just i need to recover the database
start windows, put it there start mysql, make a dump and import it into mysql-server
also you can try to copy them into /var/lib/mysql/
the db-files only
i will try that, txs
and do backups with mysqldump and not with files
yes i will dont forget that now xD
i have another problem with that, actually i need to put that database files, in a hosting .. :S
i think i have to mount a local server for put the files there and then make a backup
of course, dont to that on production-system!
i think is not wamp in ubuntu xD so ... can u apointme in some direction in order to get a functional local hosting?
sudo apt-get install mysql-server
then put your db files in /var/lib/mysql/
if you want a fully lamp, please dont use xamp or other sugestions here, just use  sudo apt-get install apache2 php5 mysql-server phpmyadmin
lamp is a meta-package, xamp is a distribution
as i told already  sudo apt-get install apache2 php5 mysql-server  and if you want, also phpmyadmin
have a loog at mod_userdir so you dont have to fight with /var/www and root:root
o well , chisese for me :S
